sentences.en: A daily one-hour news show can cost $250,000 to produce.
sentences.cn: 时长为一小时的日播新闻节目的制作费用可能会高达25万美元。

sentences.en: All of us in our daily life react favourably to people who take us and our views seriously. ＃
sentences.cn: 日常生活中，对于那些认真对待我们和我们的意见的人，我们都会与之交好。

sentences.en: Bank robberies, burglaries and muggings are reported almost daily in the press.
sentences.cn: 报纸上几乎每天都有抢劫银行、入室行窃和拦路抢劫的报道。

sentences.en: Be sure you get your daily quota of calcium.
sentences.cn: 要确保每天的钙摄入量。

sentences.en: Brush your teeth after each meal and floss daily.
sentences.cn: 餐后要刷牙，而且每天要使用牙线清洁牙缝。

sentences.en: China Daily receives dispatches from all parts of the world.
sentences.cn: 《中国日报》收到世界各地发来的电讯。

sentences.en: Daily facial exercises help her to retain the skin's elasticity.
sentences.cn: 每天做面部运动帮助她保持皮肤弹性。
每日飞往迈阿密的航班

sentences.en: Does such an attitudinal change reflect real experiences in daily life?
sentences.cn: 人生观的这种转变是否反映了日常生活中的真实遭遇？

sentences.en: More than 7 million shares changed hands, treble the normal daily average.
sentences.cn: 有700多万股换手，是通常日平均成交量的3倍。

sentences.en: Of course, the British will suffer such daily stresses patiently.
sentences.cn: 当然，英国人将会耐心地承受这些日常压力。

sentences.en: Open daily; admission £1.10 with concessions for children and OAPs.
sentences.cn: 每天开放；门票1.10英镑，儿童和退休人士可享受票价优惠。

sentences.en: Prospective buyers should study the small ads in the daily newspaper.
sentences.cn: 打算购物的人应该研究研究日报上的小广告。

sentences.en: The Daily Express describes Dr Carey as a pretty tough nut.
sentences.cn: 《每日快报》把凯里医生说成是特别难对付的家伙。

sentences.en: The Daily Mail has the headline "The Voice of Conscience"
sentences.cn: 《每日邮报》的头版标题为“良知的声音”。

sentences.en: The recommended daily dose is 12 to 24 grams.
sentences.cn: 建议每天的服用剂量为12到24克。

sentences.en: The trouble with her is she needs her daily fix of publicity.
sentences.cn: 她的问题在于她每天都想要在媒体上曝一曝光。

sentences.en: They are in twice daily radio contact with the rebel leader.
sentences.cn: 他们每天用无线电和叛军首领联系两次。

phrases.tran_cn: 每日邮报（英国伦敦的报刊）
日报表；日报单；每日报告
日销售量；日销售额，日营业额

trans.tran_en: a newspaper that is printed and sold every day, or every day except Sunday
